ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Deep parietal lobe lesion (tumor, infarct, or demyelinating process)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Confirmed by CT scan; central auditory deficits (left ear extinction on dichotic tasks, absent P300) are consistent with subcortical white matter involvement affecting the transcallosal pathway.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess word recognition ability in quiet.
To assess the integrity of the auditory brainstem pathways.
To evaluate central auditory function and interhemispheric transfer given the parietal lobe lesion.
To assess cortical and cognitive auditory processing and neural communication.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Peripheral hearing and brainstem function were normal. However, central testing revealed significant deficits consistent with a deep left parietal lobe lesion affecting the subcortical white matter. A pronounced 'left ear effect' was observed on dichotic tasks (Rhyme, CVs), indicating compromise of the transcallosal pathway required to transfer left-ear input to the left hemisphere for verbal output. Electrophysiologically, the P300 was absent or reduced, suggesting compromised neural communication.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Normal hearing sensitivity bilaterally (10-15 dB HL across 250-8000 Hz).

tests.name: Central Auditory Processing Battery
tests.result_summary: Pronounced left ear deficit on Dichotic Rhyme (~10%) and Dichotic CVs (~15%). Mild left ear deficit on SSW (~80%) and Competing Sentences (~80%). Normal performance on Dichotic Digits.

tests.name: Late Potentials (N1, P2) and P300
tests.result_summary: N1 and P2 waves normal. P300 absent (LE at C3, RE at C4) or markedly reduced (LE at C4, RE at C3).

proposed_items: Medical management of the parietal lobe lesion (tumor, infarct, or demyelinating process)
counseling_actions: Explain that peripheral hearing is normal but brain pathways connecting hearing centers are affected by the lesion.
Discuss the 'left ear effect' on dichotic tasks due to the lesion blocking the transcallosal pathway.
Highlight potential difficulties with rapid, competing speech signals despite good hearing for simple words.
Correlate auditory findings with the location of the lesion on the CT scan.

red_flags_present: Progressive right-sided numbness and gait disturbance
Deep parietal lobe lesion on CT scan

escalation.rationale_short: To determine the precise nature of the identified lesion and manage neurological symptoms.

follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor neurological status and lesion progression.
